page.title: 13Weather
page.content: The farmer is dependent on elements for its basic prosperity. The summer of 84 ws very hot and dry and the summer of 85 has been one of the wettest on record. All entrances to te fields and around the farm yards are puddles to mud by clover hooves. In the barns good silage is scarce, During 1980-84 farmers in the area were able to buy hay from other parts of the country but 1985 has been different. The whole country has suffered prolonged rain through the summer Carving cows have been hit by the disease known as Staggers. The farmers have been warned that there is a real danger of contract Farmers Lung unless they take strict precautions when handling mouldy hay.
